CodeList.Name: Drug Resistance Status

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the state or condition of the microbe or lesion to indicate whether it is resistant to drugs normally used in treatment.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Resistance to nearly all known drugs, particularly the most efficacious or non-first line drugs, used in the treatment of a particular disease.

Simultaneous resistance to a spectrum of unrelated drugs following exposure to a single agent. Mechanisms involve expression of multidrug efflux pumps (p-glycoprotein), altered glutathione metabolism, decreased topoisomerase II activity, and changes in various cellular proteins.
The growth of microorganisms are inhibited by the usually achievable concentrations of antimicrobial agent when the recommended dosage is used for the site of infection.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Drug Resistance Status Terminology
